...All the Marbles (R) 1:53 Adult language, mild violence, brief nudity. Peter Falk Burt Young
Two beautiful lady wrestlers and their wisecracking manager search for fame and fortune in a fast-action comedy. Peter Falk stars as the trainer aiming for the big time. Vicki Frederick and Laurene Landon are his “California Dolls.” With Burt Young as a sleazy promoter.		 1982:
Sep 2,​3,​5,​9,​11,​12,​18,​20,​21,​23,​28,​29		 12
...And Justice For All (R) 2:00 Profanity, adult situations, nudity. Al Pacino
There are a few lawyers who still believe in guilt and innocence. Al Pacino is brilliant in his Oscar-nominated performance as an attorney who fights the system, Comedy alternates with high drama in this look at the complexities and corruption of American justice. Christine Lahti co-stars. as a lusty lady lawyer who shares Pacino's bed, but not his convictions.		 1980:

'night, Mother (PG-13) 1:36 AS, AL SISSY SPACEK ANNE BANCROFT
In this gripping drama, based on the Pulitzer Prize-winning play, a mother and daughter strip away the outer layers of their life together. The two actresses create a brilliant tour de force as the women reveal—for the firsttime—their true feelings.		 1987:

10 (1979) (R) 1:58 AL, N Julie Andrews Dudley Moore Bo Derek
You saw her in the magazines. You loved her on the poster. Now see sensual, sensational Bo Derek in the hottest, most talked-about movie of the year, the film that makes her the sex symbol of the ‘80s. About Last Night... (R) 1:53 AL, N ROB LOWE DEMI MOORE JAMES BELUSHI ELIZABETH PERKINS
Singles in the big city, giving up on love and then giving it a shot—that’s what this hip comedy/drama is about. Rob Lowe and Demi Moore are upscale Chicagoans whose romance zigs right into sex, zags into love, but threatens to stall on the road to real commitment. James Belushi (Salvador) plays a young cynic sampling the singles scene. A sharp look at looking for love, 1980s style. 		1987:

BUY ME THAT! A KIDS SURVIVAL GUIDE TO TV ADVERTISING :30 Don't go holiday shopping without seeing this first! Consumer Reports presents an informative look at deceptive advertising. TV ads aimed at kids are examined—and challenged—in this value-packed documentary that's perfect for both children and parents. On-screen tricks—and how to see through them—are revealed to the kids who want the products, and the parents who pay for them! 1989:
Dec 6,​11,​14,​17,​19,​23		 7
Crocodile Dundee II (1988) (PG) 1:50 AL, V PAUL HOGAN
LINDA KAZLOWSKI
Is Mick Dundee any match for Colombian drug thugs? You bet your boomerang he is, mate, as everybody's favorite Aussie returns in this blockbuster comedy sequel. Growing restless in the Big Apple with his girlfriend (Linda Kozlowski), Crocodile Dundee yearns for home — but it takes his lady's kidnapping by a cocaine kingpin to get him there. From misfit city stickler to wily Outback tracker, Mick's your man for rock 'em, sock 'em laughs and action.

1st & Ten HBO SPECIAL
One of HBO's favorite comedians stars in his fifth special, but not in his usual stand-up role. In this unusual departure, Carlin plays a writer who lives in New York City, observing the details of day-to-day life with his unique brand of humor. Don't miss this look at a new, funny side of George Carlin as an offbeat character.		 1984:

First and Ten (pilot) - aka 1st & Ten Adult language, nudity. HBO COMEDY
Her ex-husband got his freedom... but she got the team! Some divorcées take the house. Some take the car. Dianne took her husband's Bulls. A sexy socialite wins her husband's football team in a divorce settlement and pro sports will never be the same! For adults.		 1984:
Dec 2,​5,​9,​11,​14,​18,​24,​27		 8

1974-1984

1941 (1979) (PG) 1:59 Adult language, humor. Dan Aykroyd
John Belushi
They roared into battle, but one thing was missing: the enemy. A comedy based on the real panic that seized California after Pearl Harbor, this misadventure features John Belushi as a maniacal pilot and Dan Aykroyd as a mechanic turned tank commander. A wacky nonstop stream of action, sight gags and special effects. Three Oscar nominations.		 1981:

Apr 11,​12,​15,​16,​24,​26,​29		 16
1979 in Sports HBO recaptures the headline-making moments of the year in this cavalcade of champions — ane near-champions. It's Willie Stargell leading his Pirates to a World Series victory straight up from near defeat. It's John McEnroe and Tracy Austin bringing tennis laurels back to the U.S.A., and Earvin Johnson trying his brand of magic on behalf of the Lakers. The Steelers roll on, Larry Holmes keeps his crown, Kurt Thomas gets ready for another Olympic gold and the Canadiens ice another Stanley Cup. 1980:

1980 World Series Scouting Report SPORTS SPECIAL
HBO Sports' up-to-the-minute scouting reports puts you inside the game by examining both club's strengths and weaknesses, their starting pitchers, their bullpens, benches, offenses and defenses. Nothing adds more enjoyment to baseball than knowing who is apt to do what. Who's the toughest out in the clutch on the two World Series teams? What's the best way to pitch to the heavy hitters? Tune in for an expert look at this year's October classic. Hosted by Len Berman. 		1980:
Oct 13,​14		 3

A Dangerous Life 6:00 AS MARCOS TAUGHT THEM FEAR.
AQUINO TAUGHT THEM COURAGE.
A SIX-HOUR MINI-SERIES EVENT
GARY BUSY
SOME THINGS ARE WORTH DYING FOR.
This epic mini-series takes you into the center of a pivotal world event—the 1986 Four-Day Revolution in the Philippines— and into the lives of the men and women who helped create it. Gary Busey stars in a drama that combines actual news-reel footage with the fictionalized story of an American newsman stationed in Manila at the time of Benigno Aquino's assassination, the fall of Ferdinand Marcos and the rise to power of the indomitable Corazon Aquino. Bristling with political controversy, high adventureand deep-felt human emotion.		 1988:
Nov 27,​28,​29

AAU Inter-City Boxing (Feb) What can the top amateur boxers in the country do in just three rounds? Plenty. HBO Sports is there for the second year of this elimination tournament. These fighters will be out to impress the judges quickly. Their trademark: all-out assault. In the first of seven consecutive Wednesday night fight cards, Atlanta takes on New York. Watch for New York’s Mitchel Green, one of the top amateur heavyweights. 1980:
Feb 27
Mar 1		 2
AAU Inter-City Boxing (March) Upper cuts, flurries of jabs and roundhouse punches are all part of the action as the nations finest amateurs try to make their mark quickly in these quarter final bouts HBO Sports continues its coverage of this rousing tournament, Miami, with its three Gray brothers, slugs it out with Philadelphia. Ace Award Winner (1988) 2:00 Presentation of feature filim or special(s) cited for 1987 ACE Award for excellence in cable programming.

The ACE awards (Award for Cable Excellence) ran from 1978 to 1997 to recogize television shows on cable that were ignored by the Emmys. Once the Emmys started acknowledging cable, they ended. Not sure what was actually shown on this night. -JS		 1988:
Jan 27		 1

LIVE January 24

America Undercover: GETTING EVEN Victims Fight Back Robbery. Assault. Rape. Murder. Violent crime strikes every 24 seconds in the U.S. Many victims are angry, scared, legally frustrated—victims for life. Others are fighting back. This film focuses on four true stories. In one, a mother works for legislative change after her daughter's rape and murder; in another, a psychologist who was mugged twice forms a victims’ counseling center. 1984:

America Undercover: Life or Death in the Emergency Room SPECIAL
The emergency room. It’s the war zone of illness and injury. Highly skilled doctors and nurses are engaged in a constant battle to save lives.This is a graphic, real-life look inside one of the nation's best for a close-up of a medical unit in action. Split-second decisions determine life or death as the dedicated team treats a critically wounded stabbing victim, a boy hit by a car and a woman injured in an auto accident who is close to death.		 1984:

America Undercover: Missing Persons: Four True Stories (1984) Every year thousands of adults vanish without a trace. One moment they're living normal lives, and the next moment they're gone. Why are these people missing, and how did they disappear? This documentary includes four true stories, revealing the devastating effects on families left behind. One bizarre situation involves a cry of foul play when a man remarries after his wife has vanished. 1984:
Aug 19,​22,​25,​28,​29,​30

This is a thought-provoking, poignant look at five families who have faced that painful question. They tell what it means to live with the consequences of their decisions. 1988:

Barbra Streisand "One Voice" 1:05 HBO MUSIC EXCLUSIVE
Get set for the music event of the year—Barbra Streisand's first full-length live concert performance in 20 years. And only HBO has it! At her Malibu ranch before a glittering celebrity audience, Streisand—recipient of two Oscars, a Tony, an Emmy and seven Grammys—sings the hits that she made famous. Songs like People, Evergreen (Oscar winner for Best Song) and The Way We Were have become contemporary classics, and Streisand gives them new glitter and polish in this not-to-be-missed concert special.		 1986:

Boxing's Best: Jack Johnson SPORTS SERIES
His style was flamboyant, his nickname was the “Galveston Giant,” and he was the first black ever to become the world heavyweight champ. Jack Johnson reigned from 1908 to 1915, in the days when a fight could go 45 rounds. Take a ringside look at his long career, including vintage footage of famed bouts with Jess Willard and James J. Jeffries plus a rare glimpse at his extraordinary private life.		 1982:
Mar 25,​29,​30,​31		 6

The Candid Candid Camera Episode 2 Here’s the second of the peeping Allen Funt shows with no holds barred. A very special birthday present—a “gift girl:” chastity belts—what they are and where to buy one; “love notes” over lunch at a truck stop; and a new pill for women “when a headache is not a headache.” Be ready for a lot more surprises that will make you laugh—and be very thankful it didn’t happen to you. 1980:

He creates the kind of outlandish situations that no one would ever want to be in. He’ll make you turn red, but mostly with laughter. Watch as Allen hides his camera in some highly unlikely spots. Championship Boxing: Marvin Hagler vs. Vito Antuofermo For the second time this year on HBO, Marvin Hagler puts his universal middleweight crown on the line. Tonight he meets arch rival and former title holder Vito Antuofermo in a scheduled 15-rounder, live from the Boston Garden. It's a matchup between two sluggers who hit hard and often. They last touched gloves late in 1979 when Antuofermo (46-5-2, 19 KOs) retained his championship against Hagler (51-2-2, 42 KOs). After their bout, each thought he had won and each wanted a rematch. This time it should be a battle.Barry Tompkins and Larry Merchant offer expert commentary. 1981:

Cocoon (1985) (PG-13) 1:57 AS, AL, BN Don Ameche
Willford Brimley
Hume Cronyn
Jack Gilford
Steve Guttenberg
Maureen Stapleton
Jessica Tandy
Gwen Verdon
Friendly aliens from a distant galaxy rev up the lives of some golden-agers in this charming fantasy. When three Florida retirees take a dip in a pool and come out rejuvenated, they think they have discovered a fountain of youth. Don Ameche won an Oscar as the feisty old man who suddenly takes to break dancing. Steve Guttenberg (Bad Medicine) plays the young skipper of a charter boat who tries to find the source of the miraculous elixir.

Common Threads: Stories from the Quilt 1:10 Take a touching and personal look at the history of the AIDS epidemic in this story of passion, tragedy and commitment. This program looks at five of the stories memorialized in the AIDS Quilt that is now touring the country. Young and old, men and woman, Common Threads shows the cross-section of Americans that has become infected with AIDS, and illustrates the love and courage they and their friends and families demonstrate in coping with the effects of this devastating illness. 1989:

Countdown to 'Looking Glass' An HBO Original Drama Scott Glenn
Michael Murphy
Helen Shaver
Patrick Watson
With Eric Sevareid
and
Nancy Dickerson as themselves
It may be later than you think. This chillingly realistic drama portrays what could be a true scenario for the outbreak of World War III. Presented from the point of view of a television news team, the shocking events are not science fiction but science fact, based on an authentic military study of how a nuclear war could start. Scott Glenn, Michael Murphy, Helen Shaver Patric Watson star as the TV reporters in this compelling, timely drama about the imminent danger of war.		 1984:
Oct 14,​18,​24,​29,​30

Coupling: Sexual Lifestyles in the '80s. SWINGING
SWAPPING
COMPUTER MATING
SEX CLUBS
MARRIAGE
What are people trying today in order to make relationships work? Sexual swinging. Commercial sex clubs. Open marriage. Traditional Marriage. Computer-dating. Dear America: Letters Home From Vietnam 1:26 Vietnam. The way it really was.
AN HBO DOCUMENTARY FILM EVENT
Two resounding thumbs up.
SISKEL & EBERT
Documentaries don't get much more powerful or vivid than this...a heartwrenching experience.
THE HOLLYWOOD REPORTER
This film should be mandatory viewing for anyone who ever thought war was glamorous
VARIETY
This is the definitive account of the Vietnam war as told in letters home from the men and women who fought there. Accompanied by authentic film footage and a sound track of songs of the era, the letters are read by such stars as robert De Niro, Kathleen Turner and Robin Williams. Here's the 'Nam you've never seen before—unless you were there.
Sunday, April 3 [1988]
A very special night.
The premiere of Hoosiers followed by Dear America.		 1988:

Encyclopedia (HBO Series) :28 NEW FAMILY SERIES
An HBO and Children's Television Workshop presentation.
Volumes of Entertainment from A to Z!
Here's a new family series that’s fastpaced, informative and fun! Encyclopedia uses comedy skits, original songs and state-of-the-art special effects to teach and entertain. This month, see Volumes A and B, covering such topics as archeology, alligators, armor, Attila the Hun, the atom, ballet, boomerangs, bagpipes, the brain and bones. Exclusively on HBO.
A new episode every Monday night starting September 19! [1987]

Apr 10,​15,​18,​21		 4
F/X (R) 1:48 AL, V Bryan Brown
Brian Dennehy
In Hollywood talk, F/X means special effects, the art of movie illusion. Rollie Tyler (Bryan Brown) is an expert, and the Justice Department wants to use his talents to make a turncoat mobster disappear after testifying in a crucial case. Rollie plans a fake murder, not knowing that the next planned death will be real—his own! A fast-paced hit thriller.		 1987:
Feb 7,​8,​10,​13,​16,​19,​23
Mar 15
Sep 6,​19,​27
1988:
Apr 5,​9,​16,​21,​29		 16
Fade to Black (R) 1:42 Profanity, violence, nudity. Dennis Christopher
Eric Binford has seen so many movies he has begun to imitate them. In a film blending horror and macabre comedy, Dennis Christopher (Breaking Away) acts out his fantasies from Dracula, Night of the Living Dead and other screen greats. Flashback: Fire at the Cocoanut Grove SERIES
Hosted by Eric Sevareid
It was a festive night in 1942 when a small flame turned Boston’s Cocoanut Grove nightclub into an inferno—and 400 people died. This unique docudrama combines historical footage with dramatic reenactment in an account of one of the worst tragedies in nightclub history. Who was to blame? Could it happen again?		 1982:

HUNDREDS FEARED DEAD
MYSTERIOUS DEATHS OF PLEASURE SHIP
Hosted by Eric Sevareid
On Sept. 8, 1934, in the midst of the Depression, the pleasure ship Morro Castle embarked on a doomed voyage. Murder, arson—both are suspected in the unexplained inferno that took 137 lives. Learn the facts and piece together the mystery of the tragic journey.		 1982:

Flashback: Wall Street Crash 1929 Four Survivors On October 29, 1929, the stock market crashed, setting off the Great Depression. Nobody knows exactly how it happened. This unusual show combines newsreels with dramatized stories of four “survivors”—a flapper, shoeshine boy, salesman and heiress. A fascinating account of the disasters effect on people's lives. 1982:

Fraggle Rock :25 A Brand New Weekly Series From the Creators of the Muppets™
HBOnly!™
Flip over HBO’s first original weekly series! Funny, fuzzy little Fraggles are the newest family of puppets from Muppet master Jim Henson. Exclusively on HBO, the brand new fantasy series drops you into the wonderful, whimsical, musical world of Fraggle Rock (pop: 10,0000 lovable Fraggles: 40,000,000 diminutive Doozers; and 3 giant Gorgs). Find them singing and playing in a bustling underground world beneath the basement of an eccentric inventor, Tune in every week to make some irresistible new friends!		 1983:

She was the ‘30s movie queen who spurned Hollywood—and paid with her spirit. In the acclaimed story of Frances Farmer, Oscar-nominated Jessica Lange is stunning as the golden girl who fought a losing battle with the star system and social convention. Gandhi (PG) 3:14 Violence. Academy Award Winner Best Picture
Ben Kingsley
Candice Bergen
A stirring, spectacular epic and winner of eight Academy Awards, including Best Picture! Ben Kingsley (Betrayal) gives an astonishing performance as one of the world's great men of peace. Director Richard Attenborough recreates Mahatma Gandhi's odyssey over five tumultuous decades. Gandhi's principles of nonviolence and passive resistance direct him to the spiritual leadership of a modern India looking to overthrow British rule. Cast includes Martin Sheen, John Gielgud and Trevor Howard.		 1984:

ELLEN GREENE
RICHARD THOMAS
JAMES WHITMORE
WINSTON REKERT
The greatest story ever sold.
An HBO two-part movie.
Ruth is a tough, sexy, hard-living rock 'n' roll singer with a seedy past and a brilliant future—if she can get the exposure she needs. Bobby Joe is the TV minister who falls in love with her and offers her an unexpected chance to make falls for Ruth—and is the only man who can expose the secret that will destroy all her hopes success. Greatest Sports Rivalries Lakers vs. Celtics Sports fans remember the ‘60s. Six times the Boston Celtics faced the L.A. Lakers for the NBA championship. It seemed the outcome always rested on a Bill Russell rebound, a miraculous pass from Bob Cousy or a basket by Jerry West. HBO Sports revisits this intense rivalry with rare footage plus interviews with past stars as they describe those pressure-cooker games. There’ll also be a special look at Russell’s legendary defensive wizardry. 1980:
Apr 23,​26,​27,​29
May 1		 5
Greatest Sports Rivalries New York Giants vs. Cleveland Browns For years, Browns-Giants games were wars. HBO brings them back with vintage footage and exclusive interviews. Watch Jimmy Brown’s power runs. Otto Graham’s passes. Paul Warfield’s catches. And then see Rosie Grier and Sam Huff, of the Giants, try to stop them—so Grank Gifford, Kyle Rote and Charlie Conerly can move the ball. To point out the caliber of talent: more than 30 stars went on to coach in the pros. 1980:
Dec 30
1981:
Jan 2,​5		 3
Greatest Sports Rivalries USC vs. Notre Dame Since the Irish beat the Trojans 13-12 in 1926, there hasn't been a breather in this series. What a line-up through the years—like O.J. Simpson, Nick Buoniconti, Pat Hayden, Joe Theismann and Rocky Blier! Hosts Barry Tompkins and Paul Hornung bring you interviews and all the spectacular catches, runs and heart-failre finales of one of the best rivalries ever. 1980:
Nov 26
Dec 2,​4		 3
Greatest Sports Rivalries Yankees vs. Dodgers Every time they met it was fireworks — and they met in 10 World Series. Remember Cookie Lavagetto's pinch hit in '47? Johnny Podres' shutout in '55? Sandy Koufax's pitching in '63? Great moments for Dodger fans. But Yankee rooters prefer Billy Martin's game-saving catch in '52, Don Larsen's perfect game in '56 and Reggie Jackson's homers in '77. See it all plus recent interviews with stars of this memorable rivalry. 1980:
May 22,​26
Jun 1,​3,​7		 5

Renee Taylor Joseph Bologna Louise Lasser Charles Grodin J ane Curtin
Celebrate life's lighter side in this new series of comedy productions—all written and produced especially for HBO by some of America's outstanding comedy talents. In HBO's first Comedy Playhouse the curtain goes up on four funny stories about love, sex and marriage behind the closed doors of America’s bedrooms. The witty vignettes include a married couple on an encounter weekend, another couple hesitantly embarking on parenthood and a fantasy-fulfilling ménage a trois.		 1984:

HBO Music Exclusive: Tina Turner Break Every Rule :55 HBO MUSIC EXCLUSIVE
Here's the queen of rock 'n' roll as you've never seen her before: in a musical performance that celebrates her roots, her life and her music. Peter Weller

HBO Pictures: Florida Straits 1:37 AL, V HBO PICTURES
Raul Julia Fred Ward Daniel Jenkins
The sorching isle of Cuba is ablaze with action in a treasure hunt to end them all. Fred Ward, Raul Julia and Daniel Jenkins star in this sizzling adventure as an unlikely trio who scour land and sea in search of buried gold. The reluctant partners—a tough loner, a cocky college kid and a Cuban ex-officer who buried the treasure 25 yaers ago—take some hair-raising spills as they outwit outlaws in pursuit of the precious booty. HBO Pictures: Long Gone 1:52 AS, AL, BN The story of a minor league team with major league dreams.
A team like the Stogies comes along once in a lifetime! They're the greatest guys you'd ever want to meet, even if they can't hit, field or draw a crowd. William Petersen stars in this rowdy comedy/drama as the team manager, who's always sure that some fresh talent will turn the team around. Virginia Madsen (Dune) plays the provocative blonde who challenges his confirmed bachelor lifestyle.		 1987:

DANNY GLOVER ALFRE WOODARD

HBO Pictures: The Lion of Africa 1:49 AL, V BROOKE ADAMS
BRIAN DENNEHY
A ROARING ADVENTURE!
Meet Grace Danet, a tough-minded, dedicated doctor practicing medicine in Africa. She needs to make it through 450 kilometers of rugged, savage terrain to a town where desperately needed medical supplies are waiting. Her only hope is Samuel Marsh, owner of a battered truck called The Lion of Africa. There's one problem: instant dislike! Brian Dennehy and Brooke Adams star in this romantic comedy/adventure.		 1987:

HBO Pictures: The Tracker 1:42 AL, V HE THOUGHT HIS DAYS OF VIOLENCE HAD ENDED
KRIS KRISTOFFERSON
Arizona rancher Noble Adams was the greatest Indian fighter in the Old West. Now he wants his son to take over the ranch. But the young man, a Philadelphia-educated lawyer, plans to leave Arizona for fortune in the East. Adams is called back into action when a religious fanatic goes on a rampage, kills a neighbor and kidnaps two young women. Can the Adams men forget their differences long enough to track down the killer and his gang? Kris Kristofferson plays Adams in this fast-paced adventure. With Mark Moses. (Platoon).		 1988:

HBO Pictures™: Murderers Among Us—The Simon Wiesenthal Story 3:00 AS, V, N BEN KINGSLEY
He was their victim.
Now he is their hunter.
PREMIERES APRIL 23
Once he was the Nazis' victim; now he is their tireless pursuer. This is the true story of Simon Wiesenthal, whose relentless search for German war criminals has indelibly burned the horrors of the Holocaust into the World's consciousness. Made with Wiesenthal's full cooperation, this searing, inspiring drama follows his life from concentration camp through reunion with a loving family to an obsession with bringing Nazis to justice. Ben Kingsley, winner of the 1982 Best Actor Oscar® for Gandhi, plays the famous Nazi hunter. with Renee Soutendijk as his wife and Craig T. Nelson as Major Harcourt.		 1989:
Apr 23,​27,​29
May 3,​9,​12,​18
Jul 9		 10
HBO Pictures™: Third Degree Burn (aka 3rd Degree Burn) 1:37 AS, AL, V, N TREAT WILLIAMS
VIRGINIA MADSEN
HBO Pictures™
Passion in the first degree. Murder in the second.
The price for getting too close.
When a love affair gets this hot, it could lead to murder. Just as hard-luck private eye Scott Weston (Treat Williams) thinks he's found the right woman at last, he's accused of killing her wealthy, older husband. Williams and Virginia Madsen (Long Gone), the bored, beautiful woman he's hired to follow, become dangerous lovers in this provocative adult thriller.		 1989:
May 28
Jun 1,​4,​7,​9,​12		 7
HBO Pictures™: Traveling Man (1989) 1:45 AS, AL HAVE GUTS, WILL TRAVEL.
JOHN LITHGOW
JONATHAN SILVERMAN
Ben Cluett is a salesman whose life is an endless round of motels, fastfood joints and two-lane highways. His new young partner, Billy, is determined to claw his way to the top. John Lithgow stars in this warmhearted comedy-drama as Ben, who's beginning to wonder if this is the life he really wants. Jonathan Silverman plays Billy, who learns a valuable lesson in frendship from Ben.
Hard work and hype made him a success.
A smart kid and a good woman are about to make him happy.		 1989:

HBO Premiere Films™ The Park is Mine 1:46 AS, AL, V, BN In the next 72 hours, Mitch Harris is going to make them listen.
TOMMY LEE JONES
In a one-man maneuver, an emotionally shattered Vietnam veteran takes NewYork's Central Park hostage. Tommy Lee Jones stars in this taut thriller as a loner who believes his dramatic act will bring attention to the plight of men who fought for their country. As the city sends its best forces in to fight against him, Jones finds himself at a point of no return, relying on his expert knowledge of jungle warfare to survive. Helen Shaver plays a persistent TV reporter who lands in the middle of danger.		 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Act of Vengeance 1:34 AS, AL, V, SC Charles Bronson is Jock Yablonski. Thousands of miners wanted him as their leader. The union boss wanted him dead.
The true story of an American hero.
Charles Bronson Ellen Burstyn
A bitter rivalry led to a violent, shattering crime. In 1969, Joseph "Jock" Yablonski challenged corrupt union chief Tony Boyle for leadership of the United Mine Workers. What followed in an isolated farmhouse jolted one of America's most powerful unions into the national spotlight. This HBO Premiere Films drama traces the chilling chain of events that ended in a horrible, unforgettable tragedy.		 1986:

HBO Premiere Films:™ All the Rivers Run Part 1 1:40 Adult situations and language, mild violence. A four-part mini-series from HBO Premiere Films

A turbulent saga of turn-of-the-century Australia

Sigrid Thornton John Waters

HBO's first mini-series, a powerful adventure filmed in rugged down under locations, tells of Philadelphia Gordon, a spirited woman determined to forge a place for herself in a man’s world. The hazards she faces on untamed rivers, an affair with an elegant man of the world, her tempestuous marriage to a rakish riverboat captain—all contribute to the series’ epic sweep. Sigrid Thornton (The Man From Snowy River) stars as the rebellious heroine; John Waters (Breaker Morant) is the dashing man she loves. The full saga will be shown in four parts on four successive evenings and then completely repeated as noted at right.
HBOnly!™		 1984:
Jan 15,​23,​27
1985:
Mar 18,​26
1986:
Aug 25
Oct 6,​20
1988:
Mar 1,​12,​30

HBO Premiere Films:™ As Summers Die 1:27 AS, AL Scott Glenn
Jamie Lee Curtis
Bette Davis
Romance, racial tension and family scandal erupt in the '50s South.
A lawyer's passion for a southern belle is surpassed only by his passion for justice. Scott Glenn fakes on a powerful small town family trying to seize land owned by a poor black woman. He receives unexpected aid—and love—from a beautiful family member (Jamie Lee Curtis) who is rebelling against her father's avarice. A scorching drama simmering with romance and sultry southern atmosphere.		 1986:

Elizabeth Taylor Carol Burnett
Two very different women find their friendship the one stable element of their topsy-turvy lives in a sophisticated comedy drama. Elizabeth Taylor and Carol Burnett star as suburban divorcées trying to collect themselves and get on with living. Taylor plays charming Deborah, who cannot imagine life without a man. HBO Premiere Films:™ Blackout 1:40 Adult situations and language, violence. Seven years ago someone murdered the Vinson family. No one knows who. Not even the killer.
TERROR WEARS A FACE ALL ITS OWN
Richard Widmark Keith Carradine Kathleen Quinlan Michael Beck
A nightmare of menace, suspicion and fear—a suspense thriller with a shattering conclusion! Richard Widmark (Against All Odds) stars as an embittered retired detective tormented by a gruesome murder he is unable to solve. Keith Carradine is an accident victim who could hold the key to the mystery. Kathleen Quinlan (Twilight Zone — The Movie) plays a nurse who marries Carradine, unaware of what his past might hold. Michael Beck (‘Celebrity’) plays Quinlan’s former lover.		 1985:

The Most Wanted Outlaw The Most Feared Lawman Which One Is Fastest?
A notorious outlaw matches wits and gunfire with his longtime adversary. In HBO Premiere Films’ fast-action western, three-time Oscar nominee Kirk Douglas plays Handsome Harry Holland, a gunslinger who once rode with Jesse James but now wants to live down the past. HBO Premiere Films:™ Finnegan Begin Again 1:52 Adult situations and language. Mary Tyler Moore & Robert Preston
They’re mismatched, mixed up and just may be perfect for each other.
A comedy with heart.
Liz and Mike seem an unlikely pair for romance. She’s a fortyish schoolteacher leading an independent life; he’s a 65-year-old lonely hearts columnist who's married. How do these two strangers come together? Mary Tyler Moore stars as the spunky, middle-aged woman seeking something special in life. Robert Preston is the older, oddball journalist who just might have what she’s looking for. With Sam Waterston and Sylvia Sidney.		 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Forbidden Adult situations, mild violence. Jacqueline Bisset
IN WARTIME GERMANY SHE HAD TO RISK EVERYTHING TO LOVE HIM.
A true story.
Lovers trapped in the terrifying world of war-torn Berlin risk their lives for a relationship forbidden by the Nazis. Jacqueline Bisset plays an aristocratic countess whose passionate affair leads her into WWII’s dangerous underground. International star Jurgen Prochnow (The Boat) is her lover, a writer from an upper-class Jewish family who’s torn between loyalty to his country and a yearning for freedom. Irene Worth gives a powerful performance as his mother. Based on a true story.		 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Fortress 1:29 AS, AL, V, BN One teacher.
Nine children.
Stalked by terror.
A lesson in survival.
RACHEL WARD
Raw courage, cunning, and strong will are the sole weapons for a teacher and her pupils when four masked strangers invade their isolated schoolhouse. What do the men want? Where did they come from? Rachel Ward faces terror in HBO Premiere Films’ action-suspense drama set against the vast plains and magnificent mountain ranges of the Australian Outback. The lonely terrain underscores the mounting tension between captors and captives, until the riveting drama explodes ina savage climax.

HBO Premiere Films:™ Gulag 2:09 Adult language, violence, nudity. For an American in the Russian Gulag the only challenge is survival.
The only hope is an impossible escape.
David Keith Malcom McDowell
Caught in the nightmare of a Soviet labor camp, an American newsman has only one chance for freedom. David Keith stars in HBO Premiere Films’ tense drama as a former Olympian covering an international sports event in Moscow. Trapped in a web of intrigue spun by the KGB and sentenced to a brutal gulag, he is unable to adjust to its killing work schedule and inhuman living conditions. With the help of a fellow prisoner (Malcolm McDowell), he launches a desperate plan for escape.		 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Murrow 1:54 AL DABNEY COLEMAN
ROBERT VAUGHN
EDWARD HERRMANN
JOHN McMARTIN
When the news was radio, he gave ita voice. When the news became television, he gave it a conscience.
The man who made the news.
DANIEL J.TRAVANTI
On the air, Edward R. Murrow was a fearless voice for millions, a man who challenged both the entire U.S. Air Force as well as a power-hungry politician. Off the air, he fought his own bosses for integrity in broadcasting. Daniel J.Travanti (Emmy winner for “Hill Street Blues") stars as the legendary newsman in HBO Premiere Films’ moving, human drama set against two decades of tension and crisis. Dabney Coleman plays CBS founder William Paley; Edward Herrmann is producer Fred Friendly; John McMartin appears as Frank Stanton. With Robert Vaughn as F.D.R.		 1986:
Jan 19,​24,​27,​30
Feb 4,​8
Mar 8
Oct 1,​6,​16,​24
1987:
Jan 1
Jul 1,​5,​10,​16		 19
HBO Premiere Films:™ Mussolini: The Decline and Fall of Il Duce - Part 1 1:45 Violence. Susan Sarandon Anthony Hopkins Bob Hoskins
While Dictator Benito Mussolini ruled Italy with an iron fist, he was unable to control his own daughter. In this compelling drama of a personal war between Il Duce and his family, Susan Sarandon plays his willful daughter, Edda—torn between devotion to her father (Bob Hoskins) and love for her husband, Count Ciano (Anthony Hopkins). This griping but little known story that affected the fate of a nation was filmed on location in Italy where these World War Il events took place. In two parts.
AS HIS NATION FIGHTS FOR SURVIVAL IL DUCE FIGHTS FOR HIS LIFE.
THE EPIC STORY THAT'S NEVER BEEN TOLD.		 1985:
Sep 8,​18,​24,​28
1987:
Sep 2,​14,​24

HBO Premiere Films:™ Reunion at Fairborough 1:50 Adult situations. He won the war but lost the girl. Forty years later he wants her back.
Deborah Kerr Robert Mitchum
Can a WWII romance, ended four decades ago, be revived in the 1980s? Robert Mitchum, a disillusioned American hero, tries to find out when he returns to England for an Air Corps reunion and searches for his love of long ago—Deborah Ker. When she reveals a secret kept from him during the war, her revelation ignites a conflict between generations that is at the heart of this bittersweet drama. With Red Buttons.		 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Sakharov 1:59 Jason Robards Glenda Jackson
To the Soviet Union, he is an enemy. To the free world, he is a hero. In HBO Premiere Films’ powerful and timely drama right out of today’s headlines, Jason Robards stars as Andrei Sakharov, the man who cannot be silenced. This distinguished Russian physicist, Nobel Prize winner and dissident dared to speak out for human rights in a repressive society. Glenda Jackson plays Elena Bonner, his wife and steadfast partner in exile. Cast includes Anna Massey and Nicol Williamson.

[Due to real-life events involving Andrei Sakharov, the premiere of this film was moved up to June 20th, pre-empting a scheduled showing of, Race for the Yankee Zephyr. -JS]		 1984:
Jun 20

HBO Premiere Films:™ The Blood of Others 2:56 Adult situations, language, mild violence. Jodie Foster Michael Ontkean
Caught in the turmoil of WWII, a pair of star-crossed lovers face overwhelming odds to keep their romance from shattering. Jodie Foster (Oscar nominee for Taxi Driver) and Michael Ontkean (Making Love) star in the powerful drama. Sam Neill heads HBO Premiere Films’ strong supporting cast, which includes Jean-Pierre Aumont, Stéphane Audran and Kate Reid. Director Claude Chabrol vividly recreates 1940s Paris in this production based on Simone de Beauvoir's novel.		 1984:

HBO Premiere Films:™ The Cold Room 1:45 Adult language, violence, rape. George Segal
The only thing worse than living your own nightmare is living someone else's.
Reluctantly joining her father on a trip to East Berlin, a rebellious student finds herself caught in a perilous time warp and possessed by the Nazi past. Carla (Amanda Pays) begins to question her own identity. George Segal stars in this psychological thriller in which past and present collide with mystifying impact.		 1984:

HBO Premiere Films:™ The Far Pavilions Part 1 1:50 Adult situations, mild violence. Ben Cross Amy Irving John Gielgud Omar Sharif
A three-part mini-series from HBO Premiere Films™. An exotic love story set against the epic sweep of battle and the splendor of 19th-century colonial India. In HBO Premiere Films’ most lavish miniseries to date, Ben Cross (Chariots of Fire) stars as a British officer, born in India, who is torn between his military duties and his love for an Indian princess. Amy Irving (Yentl) plays the woman he loves in the forbidden affair. Based on M.M. Kaye's bestseller, the strikingly photographed blend of action, romance and history was filmed on location in India. The large all-star cast includes John Gielgud, Omar Sharif, Rossano Brazzi and Christopher Lee. The full drama will unfold on three successive evenings and will be repeated completely as noted below.		 1984:

Margot Kidder
Beneath the bright lights of Hollywood lies the dark side of murder.
The sordid murder of a Hollywood film mogul lures two world-weary detectives to the case. Cops James Garner and John Lithgow uncover a slew of suspects, from filmdom's beautiful people to low-life drug dealers. This taut, suspenseful drama is adapted from the best-seller by Joseph Wambaugh (The Onion Field). Margot Kidder co-stars as a freewheeling actress. With Colleen Dewhurst.		 1984:

HBO Showcase: Conspiracy: The Trial of the Chicago 8 2:00 AL PETER BOYLE
ROBERT CARRADINE
ELLIOTT GOULD
ROBERT LOGGIA
Eight men: when they took the stand, the conscience of the country was on trial.
A powerful dramatization of an event that symbolized the ‘60s. The Chicago 8 were the anti-Vietnam War activists accused of inciting the riots that rocked the city streets during the 1968 Democratic convention. Based on transcripts of their trial, this drama includes 1987 interviews with the actual participants—Tom Hayden, Abbie Hoffman, Jerry Rubin and others.		 1987:

An international experiment.
An unbelievable nightmare.
Burt Lancaster Ben Gazzara Kate Nelligan
What happens when 15 strangers face a terrifying crisis? This riveting thriller explores a crucial issue: survival in the face of nuclear proliferation. JOHN SHEA ELI WALLACH
The gripping, true story of Elie Cohen, one of the most audacious spies of the 20th century! HBO Showcase: Time Flies When You're Alive 1:30 A true story celebrating life and love in the face of tragedy.
In 1986, actor Paul Linke and his wife learned she was dying of cancer. This is his account of their marriage, their family and the strengthening of their love in the face of her impending death. An exhilarating tour de force; funny, profound and unforgettable (L.A. Herald Examiner).		 1989:

HBO Showcase: Waldheim: A Commission of Inquiry (Condensed Version) 2:30 Is Austrian President Kurt Waldheim a war criminal? In this unprecedented television event, an International Commission of Inquiry, composed of eminent legal authorities from around the world, reviews the existing evidence as well as newly discovered information and over 35 startling eye-witness accounts to determine if there is sufficent reason to try Kurt Waldheim for war crimes. An international team of 24 historians, archivists, journalists and investigators engaged in an exhaustive 11-country search for documentation, producing over 8,000 pages of material for the Commission to review. lt's considered opinion will be announced at the conclusion of this extraordinary program. 1988:
Jun 9,​13,​17,​25,​28		 7

In this unprecedented television event, an International Commission of Inquiry, composed of eminent legal authorities from around the world, reviews the existing evidence as well as newly discovered information and over 35 startling eye-witness accounts to determine if there is sufficent reason to try Kurt Waldheim for war crimes. An international team of 24 historians, archivists, journalists and investigators engaged in an exhaustive 11-country search for documentation, producing over 8,000 pages of material for the Commission to review. lt's considered opinion will be announced at the conclusion of this extraordinary program. 1988:

World Championship Boxing
LIVE! August 10
Jose Luis Ramirez
vs.
Hector “Macho” Camacho
HBC Lightweight Title Fight
Courageous Jose Luis Ramirez came off the canvas to win the title from Edwin Rosario last November. But how will this veteran southpaw (92-4, 77 KOs) fare against a rising star—flashy Hector “Macho" Camacho? The hard-hitting challenger is undefeated in 27 bouts (16KOs). Tonight, it's brilliant talent matched against experience and heart.		 1985:

HBO Theater: Table Settings Robert Klein Stockard Channing
Place: New York City. Time: the present. Scene: the dinner table—gathering place for three generations. Robert Klein, Stockard Channing, Eileen Heckart, Mindy Cohn star in this off-Broadway comedy hit about the problems of family life.		 1982:
Apr 10,​13,​18,​22,​26,​28

HBO Theatere: Separate Tables Award-winning stars Julie Christie and Alan Bates appear together in two romantic, poignant and funny one-act dramas. In the leading roles of both plays, Christie and Bates movingly recreate the individual stories of people who reside in a seaside hotel in Bournemouth, England. Claire Bloom and IreneWorth co-star in this HBO Theatre event, directed by John Schlesinger (Oscar winner for Midnight Cowboy). Based on the play by Terence Rattigan. 1983:

HBO Theatre Event: Lerner and Loewe's Camelot HBO presents the theatre event of the 1981-82 season, direct from the Broadway stage. Richard Harris stars as King Arthur in Lerner and Loewe's acclaimed romantic musical. Videotaped on Broadway, this magical love story evokes memories of a better world and has some of the most beautiful music ever written for the stage including “If Ever I Would Leave You.”

Heartbreak Ridge (R) 2:10 AL, V, BN CLINT EASTWOOD MARSHA MASON
One of America's most popular actors directed and stars in this guts-and-glory tribute to the fighting men of the U.S. Armed Forces. Clint Eastwood plays Sergeant Tom Highway, a tough marine who knew hell in Korea and Vietnam. Now on his final tour of duty, he's got to whip a sorry platoon of green recruits into battleworthy shape. His methods are harsh, but they pay off when the Marines invade Grenada. Marsha Mason co-stars as highway's feisty ex-wife.		 1987:

Hepburn and Tracy SPECIAL
Katharine Hepburn—energetic and otuspoken. Spencer Tracy—understated and old-fashioned. Together they became one of Hollywood's most popular and enduring teams. The world will remember him as one of the most illustrious military, literary and political figures of our time. Yet he secretly fought an agonizing personal battle against depression and self -doubt. Narrated by Hal Holbrook, this documentary uses rare film footage and still photographs to create a moving account of one of the great figures in history.		 1981:

Hoosiers (PG) 1:55 AS GENE HACKMAN BARBARA HERSHEY DENNIS HOPPER
Homespun drama and wonderful performances make this hit a rousing, heartwarming experience (Newsweek). Gene Hackman stars as a basketball coach, plagued by a scandal in hsi past, who moves to a small Indiana town—and guides the underdog high school team to a state championship. A beautifully filmed, affectionate look at heartland America in the 1950s. Dennis Hopper's portrayal of the town drunk earned a 1986 Oscar® nomination as Best Supporting Actor.		 1988:

This is an informative program on how you can attempt to prevent drug and alcohol abuse by your children. It's a no-nonsense, straight half-hour of practical advice in the style of the award-winning How to Raise a Street-Smart Child. How to Raise a Street-Smart Child :45 Hosted by Daniel J. Travanti
A PROGRAM NO PARENT CAN AFFORD TO MISS
Does your child know...
...exactly who is a "stranger"?
...how to say "no" to adults?
...how to dial "911" for help?
How can you help your child protect himself against the possibility of sexual abuse, kidnapping and assault? This timely program has some surprising answers. With the help of law enforcement and child abuse experts, host Daniel J. Travanti outlines simple rules that you may never have thought of. Due to the subject matter, very young children should watch with a parent.		 1987:

Gerold Ford
Chevy Chase

KATE CAPSHAW
Hang on to your hats—Indy's back! The thrill-packed roller coaster that zoomed through Raiders of the Lost Ark™* speeds on, with Harrison Ford as intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones in this action smash. For the life of a daughter....
for the soul of a son....
far from justice....
in the heart of America.

POWERS BOOTHE

HBOriginal™ Two renowned stars appear together for the first time in a bittersweet story about two strangers who suddenly discover that they loved the same woman. Insurance Tips		 SERIES

CHER

1987 OSCAR® WINNER BEST ACTRESS

This affectionate look at those popular youngsters growing up in mid-‘60s America brings back those crazy, bittersweet, unforgettable times. Cindy Williams, Ron Howard and Candy Clark head the cast of this pleasing sequel. Although not a box office match for the first blockbuster, The N.Y. Post said: New Graffiti tops the original. 1980:

He finds the Big Apple a magic place, but not without its share of worms. Directed by Paul Mazursky (An Unmarried Woman).		 1985:

Mrs. Soffel (PG-13) 1:52 AS, V Diane Keaton Mel Gibson
This turbulent romantic drama is based on a headline story that rocked America at the turn of the century. Diane Keaton simmers as the frustrated wife of a prison warden whose attraction to a death-row prisoner (Mel Gibson) transforms her from a pious mother to a fugitive outlaw. Nadine (1987) (PG) 1:23 AL, V JEFF BRIDGES KIM BASINGER
You couldn't find a cuter almost-ex-couple than Vernon and Nadine! In 1950s Texas, Kim Basinger is about to divorce good ol’ boy Jeff Bridges when some sexy photos and a murder throw them back together. Pursued by bad guy Rip Torn, the down-home duo are kidnapped, threatened with rattlesnakes and chased with slapstick fury all the way to a giddy ending. Charm galore from Robert Benton, the director of Places in the Heart.		 1989:

Aug 1,​2,​4,​5,​6,​9		 764
Not Necessarily the News January Edition (1983) Series Premiere!
HBOnly!
Don't let the title fool you. You've never seen a news show like this. HBO's first original comedy series uncovers the laugh angle behind the headlines. Leaders and losers, celebrities and fads get parodied in a half hour of topical send-ups and put-downs.
1st Edition		 1983:
Jan 3,​4,​6,​8,​10,​17,​19,​28
Apr 16,​17
1984:
Apr 28,​30
Dec 8,​9		 15
Not Necessarily the News February Edition (1983) Zany. Fresh. Offbeat. Satiric. Funny. Insane. Hilarious. Irreverent. You'll never see a news show like this one.
2nd Edition		 1983:
Feb 1,​3,​4,​5,​8,​13,​16,​21,​24
Apr 23
1984:
May 6,​7
Dec 22		 15
Not Necessarily the News March Edition (1983) All-new episode HBO’s first comedy series. Crazy. Quick. Hilarious. Uncommon. Incongruous. Mad. You'll never see a news show like this one.

Walt Disney Productions' No Deposit, No Return (G) 1:58 David Niven
Plotting a daring vacation caper all on their own, two kids and their pet skunk create big headaches for the grown-ups—like rich grandfather David Niven. It’s fast, furious fun with plenty of suspense. Darren McGavin, Don Knotts, as the over-the-hill safe-crackers, co-star.		 1981:
Aug 8,​12,​16,​20,​24,​28		 6
No Mercy (1986) (R) 1:48 AL, GV RICHARD GERE KIM BASINGER
Revenge brought Chicago cop Eddie Jillette to New Orleans. Beauty and danger keep him there. Richard Gere stars in this fast-paced thriller as an undercover policeman seeking revenge for his partner's murder. Sexy Kim Basinger plays a sultry Cajun "owned" by a ruthless crime lord. The final confrontation will have you on the edge of your seat!		 1988:
Jan 30,​31
Feb 3,​9,​12,​16,​19

Dec 1		 12

Norma Rae (PG) 1:54 Profanity, adult situations. Academy Award Winner Sally Field as Norma Rae
Her portrayal of a spunky Southern mill worker, finding strength within herself to lead a union fight, won Sally Field this year’s Oscar. She captures all the anger and pathos of a modern woman torn between tradition and horror of the mill. Beau Bridges is her well-meaning husband and Ron Leibman, the Northerner leading her to new awareness. The film also won the Oscar for best original song.		 1980:
Aug 10,​14,​18,​22,​28,​30
Sep 2,​7,​8
1986:
Mar 28,​30
Jun 2,​11,​17,​22		 16
Alfred Hitchcock's North by Northwest 2:16 Adult situations, violence. Cary Grant Eva Marie Saint
This classic of mistaken identity and espionage is one of Hitchcock's best. Cary Grant is a businessman caught in a web of intrigue from New York to the famous climax atop Mt. Rushmore. Eva Marie Saint, James Mason co-star.		 1981:
Mar 16,​21,​25,​29		 4
North Dallas Forty (R) 1:58 Profanity, adult situations, nudity. Nick Nolte
Mac Davis
Football is the backdrop for this brutally honest, adult comedy of one mans rebellion against the sport and the system. Nick Note, a wide receiver starting to decline, is the man forced to make moral choices in an immoral world. Singer Mac Davis is impressive as his pal, a roguish quarterback with a salty tongue. Plenty of grid-iron action. Fresh, funny and powerful (Newsweek)		 1980:
Dec 28
1981:
Jan 3,​8,​12,​16,​23,​27

Humorist/comedian George Carlin, whose 1977 On Location won a National Cable Television Association award, is back by popular demand on HBO—with brand new material in a brand new show! A satirist and word-smith, Carlin's now famous Seven-words-you-don't-say-on-TV routine (which you'll hear again!) has made him a comic favorite. Out of Africa (PG) 2:41 AS, MV ACADEMY AWARD WINNER FOR BEST PICTURE
Robert Redford Meryl Streep
This stunning love story, set in a lush, lost paradise, won seven Oscars including Best Picture. Meryl Streep plays Karen Blixen, who comes to Kenya in 1913 for a marriage of convenience. There she meets the love of her life—a charming adventurer. But can she keep him? Robert Redford is the man who captures her heart. Based on Karen’s memoirs written under the name of Isak Dinesen. With Klaus Maria Brandauer.		 1987:

WILLEN DAFOE
CHARLIE SHEEN
This searing, powerful drama of American soldiers in Vietnam was nominated for eight 1986 Oscars® and won four, including Best Picture and Best Director (Oliver Stone). Charlie Sheen (Wall Street) plays a young, idealistic recruit who wants to rest himself on the battlefield—and gets much more than he bargained for. Brilliantly acted (New York magazine). Ragtime (PG) 2:39 Adult situations and language, violence, nudity. James Cagney
Elizabeth McGovern
Howard E. Rollins
Mary Steenburgen
Turn-of-the-century characters are caught in the turbulence of fast-changing America. The lush movie, based on E.L. Doctorow's best-seller, earned eight Academy Award nominations, including one for Harold E. Rollins as a black pianist and another for Elizabeth McGovern as the legendary beauty Evelyn Nesbit. James Cagney plays New York City’s wily police commissioner in an innovative drama blending history and fiction.

HBO's Remember When "Way Out West" SERIES PREMIERE
The Story of the American Cowboy. Remember when cowboys roamed the frontier of the Old West? Life in that fabled era is the subject of the first in HBO’s exclusive eight-part sequel to the award-winning Time Was series. Host Dick Cavett reviews the facts and fiction surrounding the great American legacy—the cowboys and outlaws; the frontier cities, saloons and women; the rodeos and western movies.		 1981:
May 11,​14,​17,​23,​27,​29
1984:

1989:
Oct 9,​13,​17		 21
HBO's Remember When "On the Air" SPECIAL
The Story of Radio in America
Dick Cavett hosts this exciting history of radio from Marconi to the end of big-time radio. Using newsreels, on-location footage and movie clips, Cavett highlights: Bing Crosby; Jack Dempsey’s historic title bout; FDR’s fireside chats; radio bloopers; Major Bowes Amateur Hour; the big bands; the mystery shows and much more. It was the magic of the airwaves, and it was wonderful.		 1981:
Jun 8,​11,​14,​17,​19,​24
1984:
Sep 8,​11,​12,​14
1985:
Dec 7,​12,​17,​23,​26		 16
HBO's Remember When "Wheels, Wings and Whistles" SPECIAL
The Story of Transportation in America.
The paddle-wheel steamships, the Wright brothers at Kitty Hawk, the golden railroad spikes, the first man on the moon—it’s the story of a nation in motion from landing at Plymouth Rock to exploring outer space. Dick Cavett recalls it all in the third episode of HBO’s exclusive eight-part series about our history and our national identity.		 1981:

Dick Cavett hosts HBO's exclusive series exploring our national identity. The story of inventors who changed the face of America and inventions that revolutionized our life as well as the gizmos that failed to find any practical use (an automatic hat tipper?). Sky Spectacular SPORTS SPECIAL
High-flying entertainment as the sky is turned into a giant sports arena during this novel and fascinating air show. Almost 11,500 aircraft from 50 different countries will be on hand for the Oshkosh Air Show, the largest sports-aviation event in the world. Aerial acrobatics, formation flying, wing walking, aerial clowning and daredevil stunts will make you laugh, gasp and keep you on the edge of your seat. On top of all that, there's a look at planes of the future and vintage film of aviation’s glorious past.		 1980:

HBO Sneak Preview Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara, the country’s number one comedy couple, tell you what to expect on HBO in an entertaining combination of comic sketches and highlights from upcoming specials, sports and movies.

Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara were the hosts of HBO Sneak Preview until December of 1981. Leonard Harris became the new host in January of '82. The show ended with the Sneak Peak of September '82, which was replaced with HBO Magazine, hosted by Dick Cavett. -JS		 1980:

So You Wanna Be A Star? SPECIAL
What does it take to get to the top? This exclusive HBO documentary shows you the true story of five aspiring young performers and their determination to “make it” in the world of entertainment. Valerie Lee, a dancer-singer-acress trying to succeed on Broadway; Larry Miller, a young comedian; Charly McClain, a country western singer; Zora Rasmussen, a nightclub performer, and Rocky Bauer, a young actor. Can they make it? Will they rise to stardom? An inspiring and moving look at the world of “Show Biz.”		 1981:
Aug 29

A sensitive account of some extraordinary human oddities. Hosted by Richard Kiley, the show features 25” Tom Thumb, 8’ 11” Robert Pershing Wadlow, the tallest man who ever lived; Robert Earl Hughes, whose 1,069 Ibs. made him the heaviest human on record, and others.		 1981:

A lonely, skeptical corporal returns to his Indiana home after WWII and soon becomes involved with two vastly different women. This 1959 classic features Frank Sinatra as the ex-Gl; Shirley MacLaine, a pickup from Chicago; and Dean Martin, a genial gambler who takes Sinatra under his wing.		 1981:

Margot Kidder
No-luck Eddie Keller loses everything but his sense of humor in this bitterly funny, offbeat comedy drama. Richard Pryor (... Live on the Sunset Strip) plays the heroic misfit who finds life at home contains more nightmares than his six years as a Vietnam POW. Sports Around The World: Australian Surf Lifesaving Australian Surf Lifesaving.
It began as a way to save lives and is now one of the biggest athletic events in the world. HBO jets to Australia, where 5,000 sturdy competitors challenge thunderous waves as they sprint, row, kayak, surf and swim. Five-man crews race 25-foot whaleboats out to sea and back in the most exciting team event. The most grueling individual matchup isThe Iron Man grind, a combination of rowing, distance swimming and sprinting.		 1980:

Switching Channels (PG) 1:45 AS, AL BURN REYNOLDS
KATHLEEN TURNER
CHRISTOPHER REEVE
When a TV anchorwoman tries to change channels on her life and career, her boss (and ex-husband!) will stop at nothing to keep her turned to his dial. A superstar cast sparks the laughs in this snappy update of The Front Page. Kathleen Turner, tempted by a new job and new love Christopher Reeve, practically has her bags packed when her ex, Burt Reynolds, puts her on a story to keep her nearby. Romantic mayhem and comedy zingers multiply deliciously in this romp.		 1989:

HBO Picture: Sword of Gideon 2:28 Steven Bauer
Michael York
Rod Steiger
Colleen Dewhurst
Five men sworn to avenge the Munich Olympic Massacre. To international terrorists, they are a deadly threat. To Israel, they are the SWORD OF GIDEON.
Five men with a single goal: to avenge the massacre of Israeli athletes. In this gripping work of fiction, their mission plunges them into danger and intrique as they pursue their targets across Europe. Steven Bauer Scarface stars in this suspense thriller as the courageous leader of the handpicked team, coolly following orders from a top-secret intelligence organization. Colleen Dewhurst is powerful in her role as Golda Meir. Filmed in the Mideast, Paris and the U.S.		 1986:

Tailspin: Behind the Korean Airliner Tragedy 1:30 AN HBO ORIGINAL MOVIE
MICHAEL MURPHY
HARRIS YULIN
MICHAEL MORIARTY
CHRIS SARANDON
TERRIFYING. TOP SECRET. TRUE. THE INSIDE STORY TWO GOVERNMENTS WERE AFRAID TO TELL.
In August 1983, Korean Airlines Flight 007 was shot down over Soviet airspace. Everyone aboard — 269 innocent people — was killed. Did the Soviet military make a tragic error, or was it a deliberate, brutal attack? Extensively researched, this chillingly real HBO Original Movie takes us inside Washington's corridors of power to probe the extraordinary truth behind the most serious threat to world peace since the 1962 Cuban missle crisis.		 1989:
Aug 20,​23,​26,​27,​29

Racing anything on wheels, from motorcycles to Rolls-Royces, an all-star cast mixes wild action and comedy in a coast-to-coast, anything-goes contest. Burt Reynolds and zany Dom DeLuise pilot an ambulance carrying Farrah Fawcett disguised as a patient. Roger Moore plays a tycoon who thinks he’s James Bond, while Dean Martin and Sammy Davis, Jr., pose as priests driving a Ferrari.

He had four years to plan his revenge and one week to pull it off.
Getting even is worth waiting for.

The Last Emperor (PG-13) 2:46 AL, V, BN 1987 OSCAR® WINNER BEST PICTURE
JOHN LONE
PETER O'TOOLE
JOAN CHEN
“Mesmerizing” says Newsweek about this winner of nine 1987 Oscars®, including Best Picture and Best Director (Bernardo Bertolucci). This dazzling saga tells the stor of Pu Yi, the 3-year-olbdoy who became emperor of China in 1908. Living in the spectacular Forbidden City, Pu Yi grew up in sumptuous surroundings accompanied by royal treatment. Later deposed, the last emperor became a western-style playboy and then Japan's puppet emperor of Manchuria until the end of World War I! John Lone plays Pu Yi in his adult years. Peter O'Toole plays Reginald Johnson, his British tutor.
1989:
Feb 12,​15,​18,​21,​24,​26
Mar 11		 8
HBO Pictures:™ The Last Innocent Man 1:43 AS, AL, V, N Ed Harris Roxanne Hart
A top criminal defense lawyer is drawn into a baffling, treacherous maze of violence and deceit in this tense drama that will keep you guessing to the very end. Ed Harris (Sweet Dreams) stars as the defense attorney whose courtroom successes have left him disillusioned with the legal profession. On the verge of quitting, he is persuaded to take on one more case by a beautiful, seductive woman. With Darrell Larson (Twice in a Lifetime).		 1987:

The Right Stuff (PG) 3:16 Adult situations, language. Sam Shepard Scott Glenn
Dennis Quaid Kim Stanley
Nominated for eight Academy Awards and winner of four, this movie is a rousing tribute to the heroism of America's first astronauts. An all-star cast heads the grand-scale adventure, a funny and touching story of bravery, camaraderie and personal trials. Sam Shepard stars as Chuck Yeager, the test pilot who broke the sound barrier. Dennis Quaid, Scott Glenn and Ed Harris play members of the Mercury 7 team. Based on the best-seller by Tom Wolfe.		 1984:

At the 1980 World Speed Skiing Championships they’ll attempt to break the unpowered land-speed record of 124 mph at Storm Peak, Colo. Then on to Hawaii for hang gliding in the world’s toughest wind. The resignation of a president. Vietnam. Patty Hearst, the rise of cults. Positive action toward peace in the Middle East. From the “Camelot” days of JFK to the conservatism of Nixon when policies at home were attacked and unrest was nationwide. To Catch A King Adult situations, mild violence. HBOnly!™
Robert Wagner Teri Garr
In wartime Europe two Americans stumble upon a Nazi plot that could change the course of history.
An adventure of espionage and intrigue. Two expatriate Americans in neutral Portugal try to foil a German scheme to capture the Duke and Duchess of Windsor. The HBO Premiere Film stars Robert Wagner (‘Hart to Hart’) and Teri Garr (Oscar nominee for Tootsie) as a nightclub owner and a cabaret singer caught up in high-stakes action in spy-infested Lisbon. An absorbing blend of suspense, light comedy and romance. Barbara Parkins plays the Duchess.		 1984:

A real hero of the Old West, one of the last frontiersmen, Tom Horn is a cool loner, a man of action and few words. Steve McQueen plays the legendary bounty hunter as he nears the end of his trail. Jessica Lange
Teri Garr
Dressed as a woman to audition for a TV soap opera, a desperate New York actor finds himself leading a frantic double life. This is the premise for one of the most popular comedies in Hollywood history, a smash with both the public and the critics. Dustin Hoffman plays the edgy, cantankerous Michael Dorsey, who transforms himself into poised, self-assured Dorothy Michaels. Jessica Lange won an Oscar as the soap star who confides in her matronly new colleague. With Bill Murray (Stripes) and Dabney Coleman (WarGames). USA for Africa: The Story of "We Are The World" (aka We Are the World: The Story Behind the Song) :53 Michael Jackson Kenny Rogers
Cyndi Lauper Diana Ross
Willie Nelson Bruce Springsteen
Lionel Richie Tina Turner
Stevie Wonder
One night in January, 1985, forty-five of the top names in American music raised their voices as one to fight famine in Africa. The result: the hit record, “We Are the World.” HBO salutes this historic gathering with the only complete close-up of the unprecedented recording session. Don't miss this opportunity to see these talented people working for a worthy cause.		 1985:

HBO's entertaining series about the world of science and human behavior. Topics include: bodyclocks—is there a best time of the day to make love? Is it possible to be younger than your years? VAL KILMER

Wimbledon '87 HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
Nine days of the world's greatest tennis!
HBO does it better than anybody else says Tennis Magazine about HBO’s Wimbledon coverage. In addition to expert Centre Court coverage, you'll see an upset in the making or a critical tie breaker. Wimbledon '88 HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
HBO is simply far and away the best says Tennis magazine of HBO's award-winning coverage of the world’s most renowned tennis tournament. Roving cameras switch from centre to outer court action, zeroing in on crucial tie-breakers, possible upsets and breaking stories. HBO experts, including Arthur Ashe and Billie Jean King, bring you a total of nearly 27 hours of midweek action, from early round play through the women's semi-finals. Plus nightly updates.		 1988:
Jun 20,​21,​22,​23,​24,​27,​28,​29,​30		 23

Wimbledon! (1980) From the action at center court to the Royal Box and bowls of cream-drenched strawberries, Wimbledon is tennis’ most prestigious event. Catch every important serve, slam and volley as HBO brings you same-day highlights of the best early-round matches. Bjorn Borg, aiming for an unprecedented five straight titles, must hold off John McEnroe and Jimmy Conners. Martina Navratilova, trying for her third straight, will battle Tracy Austin and maybe Chris Evert Lloyd. 1980:
Jun 23,​24,​25,​26,​27,​28
Jul 1,​2,​3,​4		 14
Wimbledon '81 SPORTS SPECIAL
The world’s finest players gather each year for the sport’s most coveted prize. Jimmy Connors aptly calls it the Olympics of tennis. See the best at their best from Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe to Chris Evert Lloyd and Tracy Austin. Arthur Ashe will be there for HBO to bring you same-day highlights of early-round matches, and the women’s quarterfinals on June 30th. Continues into July!		 1981:
Jun 22,​23,​24,​25,​26,​30
Jul 1,​2,​3		 13
Wimbledon '82 Be courtside for tennis’ most prestigious event with HBO's expanded, same-day coverage. The great names will be there, along with the 1981 champs, John McEnroe and Chris Evert Lloyd. June 21-25:match play cover- age plus the day’s highlights; June 22- 26: previous day's highlights; June 28: men's round of 16; June 29: women's quarterfinals; June 30: men's quarterfinals; July 1:women’s semifinals.

Wimbledon '83 Nine Days of the World's Greatest Tennis!
For the ninth consecutive year, HBO brings you the most prestigious event in tennis. See more tennis than ever before—all four main courts will be covered, plus a roving camera and reporter will switch to any other breaking story. Arthur Ashe, BBC's John Barrett and Barry Tompkins guide you through all the spectacular action. Get the drama of same-day match play and complete tournament highlights—including a special Wimbledon update every night.

Without a Trace (PG) 1:58 Adult situations and language. Kate Nelligan Judd Hirsch
Six-year-old Alex gets up one morning, dresses for school, waves goodbye to his mother . . . and disappears. As the police mount a massive effort to find the child, his mother struggles to bear the harrowing anxiety. World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Bramble vs. Mancini HBO SPORTS EVENT
World Championship Boxing
LIVE!
Livingstone Bramble-“Boom-Boom” Mancini Rematch
Look for fireworks in this rematch of last June's championship. That battle cost Mancini his lightweight title in a stunning upset. Knocked out in the 14th round, he was beaten at his own pressure game Bramble’s sharp, inside attack never let up. Ever since, Mancini's been waiting for a rematch. This fight, scheduled for 15 rounds, promises to be one of the best of the year.		 1985:

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Curry vs McCrory ★ LIVE! ★
HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
DONALD CURRY vs. MILTON McCRORY
DECEMBER 6
WELTERWEIGHT UNIFICATION TITLE FIGHT
Tonight, two undefeated champions clash for the unified welterweight title. Not since Sugar Ray Leonard has one  man worn both welterweight crowns. And not since Sugar Ray have we seen a boxer the likes of Donald Curry, a superb technician in the ring. But the hard-hit-ting McCrory is no slouch. Packing a lethal left jab and a powerful right, he won his first 16 fights by KOs. Scheduled for 15 rounds, this fight should be a beauty. 		1985:
Dec 6		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Double Header Starling vs. Breland and Chavez vs. Aguilar HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
LIVE APRIL 16
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING DOUBLEHEADER
WBA WELTERWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
WBA CHAMPION
MARLON STARLING
vs.
FORMER WBA CHAMPION
MARK BRELAND
Two terrific 12-rounders!Fighter of the Year Julio Cesar Chavez defends his WBA Lightweight crown against #1 contender Rodolfo Aguilar. Also, Mark Breland tries to regain the WBA Welterweight title from Marlon Starling. Breland was ahead on points last August when Starling nailed him. In tonight's rematch, his future and reputation are on the line.

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Dwight Braxton vs. Matthew Saad Muhammad Tonight Saad Muhammad is out to regain theWBC light heavyweight title from champ Dwight Braxton—the man who shocked him in a startling upset last December. But Saad will first have to stop Braxton’s power-house right. Scheduled for 15 rounds, this revenge bout should be a battle. 1982:
Aug 7		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Dwight Braxton vs. Michael Spinks It's winner-take-all tonight as the undisputed World Light Heavyweight title is on the line—with two great Champions slugging it out in a scheduled 15 rounder. WBC titleholder Braxton (only 5’6” tall) will be constantly moving, crowding Spinks, with hard, crisp jabs. But undefeated WBA champ Spinks is a paralyzing puncher—his chief enforcer is the “Spinks Jinx,” a smashing overhand right. It’s a classic match-up of contrasting ring styles. 1983:
Mar 18		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Edwin Rosario vs. Julio Cesar Chavez THE FIGHT OF THE YEAR!
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
WBA LIGHTWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
WBA Lightweight Champion
EDWIN ROSARIO
vs.
WBC Super Featherweight Champion
JULIO CESAR CHAVEZ
Undefeated Julio Cesar Chavez (52-0), the WBC Super Featherweight king, has been called the finest fighter, pound for pound, in the world. Tonight he steps up in weight to challenge Edwin Rosario (26-2, 22 KOs) for his WBA Lightweight crown. This matchup should show you why lightweight bouts are famous for flashy, fast-paced excitement.

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Greg Page vs. Tim Witherspoon LIVE! HBOnly! LIVE!
World Championship Boxing
Greg Page vs. Tim Witherspoon
WBC Heavyweight Championship
Tonight the WBC heavyweight title is up for grabs as the two top contenders battle for the crown recently vacated by Larry Holmes. New names and faces will now fight for the spotlight. Greg Page has beaten the best in the division, losing only once in 24 bouts. He never got his chance at Holmes, but Tim Witherspoon did, losing a controversial split decision. It should be a battle when these evenly matched, young punchers lock horns for 12 rounds.

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Hagler vs. Hearns Tonight WBA/WBC champion Hagler and ex-welter-weight champ Hearns meet head-on for the world middleweight crown. Marvelous Marvin Hagler (52-2-2, 45 KOs), who hasn't lost a bout in over six years, faces his toughest challenge to date in Thomas Hearns (34-1, 31 KOs)—who has already won twice in his new division. HBO is the only national pay TV service showing this event. (Will not be seen live in the Detroit area.)
HBOnly!™

Note: This fight never happened. After the guide was printed, it was changed to a fight between Hagler and Fulgencio Obelmejias, but then that was cancelled due to an injury from Hagler. Still investigating what aired during this time. -JS		 1982:
Jul 15		 1

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Hector "Macho" Camacho vs. Edwin Rosario HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
HECTOR "MACHO" CAMACHO
vs.
EDWIN ROSARIO
WBC LIGHTWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
The dazzling "Macho Man" defends his WBC Lightweight title against ex-champ Edwin Rosario. The unbeaten Camacho (29-0) faces a talented boxer in Rosario, who's only lost once in 24 matches. This scheduled 12-rounder promises brilliant boxing.
LIVE! JUNE 13		 1986:
Jun 13		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Bey Only on HBO! LIVE! March 15
Heavyweight Title Fight
Tonight we could see history in the making as Larry Holmes defends his IBF heavy-weight crown against a hungry challenger, David Bey. Bey (14-0) won this shot at Holmes with his solid upset of Greg Page. In his last fight, the aging champ had a tough time stopping James “Bonecrusher” Smith. Can the proud, undefeated Holmes preserve his perfect record?		 1985:
Mar 15		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Cooney — The Pride and the Glory 1:30 HBO Sports WBC Heavyweight Championship Larry Holmes vs. Gerry Cooney

This was a last minute edition to the schedule and does not appear in the HBO Guide for June of 1982. The fight, which took place on June 11th, 1982, did not air live on HBO, but instead on closed-circuit-television and pay-per-view. The re-broadcasts replaced scheduled airings of "High Risk" on the 18th and "Silver Streak" on the 20th. -JS		 1982:
Jun 18,​20		 2
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Smith World Championship Boxing
LIVE! ★ November 9
Exclusive
Larry Holmes
vs.
James “Bonecrusher” Smith
It's youth versus experience in this scheduled 15-rounder. Undefeated heavyweight champ Larry Holmes returns to the ring to defend his International Boxing Federation title against James ‘Bonecrusher"' Smith. Holmes, with 45 wins, wants to make the record books by passing Rocky Marciano's record of 49-0. His opponent, with a record of 14 wins and only one loss, knocked out Frank Bruno last time out.		 1984:
Nov 9		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Spinks HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
LARRY HOLMES
★ VS. ★
MICHAEL SPINKS
LIVE!
SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 21
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
IFB HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
Will Larry Holmes equal Rocky Marciano’s record of 49-0? Or will Michael Spinks be the first light heavyweight champ in history to capture the heavy-weight crown? Although Holmes has a big edge in size and reach, Spinks is a cagey boxer with a paralyzing right. See these two greats clash in this scheduled 15-rounder and also catch some exciting preliminary bouts.		 1985:
Sep 21		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Iron Mike Tyson vs. Carl "The Truth" Williams HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
LIVE! JULY 21
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
IRON MIKE TYSON
UNDISPUTED HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION
vs.
CARL The Truth WILLIAMS
IBF #1-RANKED CONTENDER
Undefeated WBA/WBC/IBF heavyweight champ Tyson faces IBF #1-ranked contender Williams in defense of his unified title. These two are former sparring partners, and Williams fels he can beat Tyson with a hard jab, mobility and a lot of thinking. But I can't be beaten, says Tyson, who last time out crushed Frank Bruno in five. If this one goes the scheduled 12 founds, Williams just might have a chance!		 1989:
Jul 21		 1

MICHAEL SPINKS
VS.

EUROPEAN HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION
Undefeated Michael Spinks, in his second title defense, faces European heavyweight champ Steffen Tangstad. Spinks became the first light heavyweight to ever capture the heavyweight crown. But he barely won the rematch with Larry Holmes in a controversial split decision. Is Spinks tough enough to stop this rugged young Norwegian? Scheduled for 15 rounds.

UNIFIED CHAMPION
MIKE TYSON
vs.
Larry Holmes
LIVE!
JANUARY 22
Tonight, Mike Tyson gives Larry Holmes a crack at his unified WBA/WBC/IBF heavyweight crown. This is Tyson's second title defense. Last October he stopped Tyrell Biggs with a crushing seventh-round KO. But if anyone can out-box him, it's Holmes. For years he dominated the division, losing only twice t Mchael Spinks—and many felt Holmes won the last controversial decision. Now the embittered veteran comes out of retirement fighting for his pride and his reputation.		 1988:

WBA/WBC CHAMPION
MIKE TYSON
VS.
WBC #1-RANKED CONTENDER
PINKLON THOMAS
LIVE! MAY 30
The youngest heavyweight champ in boxing history—and one of the most ferociously exciting fighters in recent years—defends his two-month-old unified title in a scheduled 12-rounder. In his last two fights 20-year-old Mike Tyson picked up the WBC and WBA crowns. Now he'll face ex-WBC champ Pinklon Thomas, who has lost only once in 31 bouts, With his penetrating left jab, Thomas will try to do what 29 other boxers have failed to do—stop Mike Tyson.		 1987:

The third unified title defense for Mike Tyson comes to you live from Tokyo! Fresh from his victory over Larry Holmes, he now faces former WBA champ Tony Tubbs (24-1, 15 KOs). Can Tubbs prove him wrong?

World Championship Boxing: Sugar Ray Leonard vs. Thomas Hearns 1:29 I believe this is a replay of the fight from Sept. 16, 1981 at Caesars Palace. What's odd is that according to the guides, this hadn't aired on HBO before. There was a special hyping the then upcoming match called, "Countdown to the Showdown Leonard-Hearns" that aired in Sept. of '81, but this is the first record of the actual match airing on HBO. -JS 1989:

World Series Scouting Report (1981) As vital as statistics are to baseball fans, they are often not enough. That's why this 60-minute special on the October classic bats 1,000. You'll learn the strengths, weaknesses and idiosyncrasies of both World Series teams—from benches to bull pens, from hitters to fielders, from starting pitchers to specialists. Richard Belzer
Howie Mandel
Robin Williams
Steven Wright
You know these guys. They’re all alumni of HBO's Young Comedians specials who went on to become super-stars. Back in their favorite comedy clubs, they introduce some of today’s brightest new comics. It's the Young Comedians 10th anniversary celebration, so be prepared for the utterly outrageous, the downright raucous, the just plain funny—and almost anything else.		 1986:
